page.title: 03NATURE RESERVE continued
page.content: In 1940 the area was a gun site forming part of the Second World War defence system along the coastal area. The concrete gun emplacements and barracks remain, but the old road which once provided access for army vehicles is almost completely overgrown, illustrating how nature, if left undisturbed, provides a continually changing habitat for wild life. If left unchecked the area would be taken over by wild rose, bramble and ash trees. In order to allow the rarer plants to flourish, some clearance work is carried out each year by volunteer workers.
